English: what? why?; also used at beginning of sentence to indicate a yes/no question
at the beginning of sentence: marks a sentence as a yes/no question; even, also (postposed)
to be attached to, feel affection for, love (+ loc.)
alone, only, just (postposed; emphasises what precedes); indeed
indeed, surely (emphatic particle; sometimes best lest untranslated)
marks the end of a clause, quotation or thought
to be; to become, come to be
to be required to; to be able to; one should, ought (+ inf.)
to enjoy, be pleased with (+ inst. or other cases)
of me, my; for/to/by me (Gen./Dat. Sing.)
proper, appropriate for (+ gen.); required, onliged to (+ inf.)
Sugrīva (king of the monkeys, on Rama's side)
loyally loving (lit. one whose love is set)
the delighter of Raghu (Rāma's grandfather): a name for Rāma
